page.title: 03Rowhills Nature Reserve
page.content: { Rowhills Nature Reserve}lies on the Surrey and Hampshire border between Farnham and Aldershot. The reserve covers an area of about{50 acres of woodland and {heathland.}This land is owned by the Borough of Rushmoor. The actual reserve is surrounded by housing and development. Really it is a green belt between the towns. If you want to go on a nature trail you can go right around the reserve . The reserve has two ponds, one is called{King Fisher Pond}and the other{Stickle Back Pond.}The reserve has a marsh and a plateau which is a playing field. The reserve has two rivers that link up with the ponds. It has a hut where they give lectures and where other activities occur.
